SEARCH
Module org.myjtools.imconfig
Package org.myjtools.imconfig

Interface Config

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractConfiguration, ApacheConfiguration2
public interface Config
The main interface used to get configuration values and create derived configurations.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type

      Create a new defined configuration

    • withPrefix

      Config withPrefix(String keyPrefix)
      Creates a new configuration resulting of adding the given prefix to every key

    • filtered

      Config filtered(String keyPrefix)
      Creates a new configuration resulting of filtering the properties starting with the given prefix

    • inner

      Config inner(String keyPrefix)
      Creates a new configuration resulting of filtering the properties starting with the given prefix, and the removing it

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns:
      true if there is no properties in this configuration

    • isNotEmpty

      boolean isNotEmpty()
      Returns:
      true if there is any property in this configuration

    • hasProperty

      boolean hasProperty(String key)
      Returns:
      true if there is a valued property with the given key

    • notHasProperty

      boolean notHasProperty(String key)
      Returns:
      true if there is not any valued property with the given key

    • keys

      Stream<String> keys()
      Returns:
      A stream from all the keys of the configuration, even for those which have no value

    • get

      <T> Optional<T> get(String key, Class<T> type)
      Returns:
      An optional value of the specified type, empty if the key does not exist

    • get

      <T> Optional<T> get(String key, Function<String,T> converter)
      Returns:
      An optional value converted from a string, empty if the key does not exist

    • getInteger

      Optional<Integer> getInteger(String key)
      Returns:
      An optional integer value, empty if the key does not exist

    • getLong

      Optional<Long> getLong(String key)
      Returns:
      An optional long value, empty if the key does not exist

    • getFloat

      Optional<Float> getFloat(String key)
      Returns:
      An optional float value, empty if the key does not exist

    • getDouble

      Optional<Double> getDouble(String key)
      Returns:
      An optional double value, empty if the key does not exist

    • getString

      Optional<String> getString(String key)
      Returns:
      An optional integer value, empty if the key does not exist

    • getObject

      <T> T getObject(Class<T> configClass)
      Instantiate a new object with its fields filled according the configuration.

    • getList

      <T> List<T> getList(String key, Class<T> type)
      Returns:
      A list with values of the specified type, empty if the key does not exist

    • getSet

      <T> Set<T> getSet(String key, Class<T> type)
      Returns:
      A set with values of the specified type, empty if the key does not exist

    • getStream

      <T> Stream<T> getStream(String key, Class<T> type)
      Returns:
      A stream with values of the specified type, empty if the key does not exist

    • asProperties

      Properties asProperties()
      Returns:
      The configuration represented as a Properties object

    • asMap

      Map<String,String> asMap()
      Returns:
      The configuration represented as a Map object

    • forEach

      void forEach(BiConsumer<String,String> consumer)
      Perform an action for each pair [key,value]

    • append

      Config append(Config otherConfiguration)
      Create a new configuration resulting in the merge the current configuration with another one

    • hasDefinition

      boolean hasDefinition(String key)
      Returns:
      whether there is a definition for the given property

    • validations

      List<String> validations(String key)
      Check whether the current value for the given property is valid according its definition. If the property is multi-valued, it may return a different validation for each value
      Parameters:
      key - The property key
      Returns:
      The validation messages, or empty if the value is valid

    • getDefinition

      Optional<PropertyDefinition> getDefinition(String key)
      Retrieve the property definition for a given property

    • getDefinitions

      Map<String,PropertyDefinition> getDefinitions()
      Retrieve every property definition defined for this configuration
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable map in the form of invalid input: '<'property,definition>

    • validations

      Map<String,List<String>> validations()
      Return a map in form of property=[validation_message1,...] with the validation error messages for all invalid properties values according the current definition.

      Configurations without definition will always return an empty map.

    • validate

      Config validate() throws ConfigException
      Ensures that all property values are valid according the current definition. Otherwise, it will raise a ConfigException with a list of every invalid value.

      Configurations without definition will never raise an exception using this method

      Returns:
      The same instance, for convenience
      Throws:
      ConfigException - if one or more properties have invalid values

    • accordingDefinitions

      Config accordingDefinitions(Collection<PropertyDefinition> definitions)
      Create a new configuration according the given property definitions.

      Defined properties will be set to their default value if it exists and no current value is set.

      See Also:
      • PropertyDefinition

    • getDefinitionsToString

      String getDefinitionsToString()
      Get a textual representation of all defined properties
